medium: Cast and chased gold with rubies, sapphires and jade
title: Presentation Boxes
text: Made of exquisitely crafted gold, these five boxes bearing emblems of the Eight Taoist Immortals are from an original set of eight which was presented to the Ch'ien-lung emperor in 1779, perhaps on the occasion of his birthday. Superbly worked in cast, chased and filigree techniques, these objects stand as a testament to the technical virtuosity so often encountered in Ch'ien-lung period (1736-1797) decorative arts. The whereabouts of the three missing boxes is unknown.
description: Gold presentation box; surface chased with swastika-fret design. Bears fan, emblem of Chung-Li Chuan, surrounded by delicately spun gold blossoms picked out with small cabochon rubies, saphires and green jade. One of a set of 8 presented to Emporor Ch\'ien Lung in the 43rd year of his reign.
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Augustus L. Searle
